item.title: Moxie add a quote by Archimedes
item.description: "Give me a place to stand, and a lever long enough, and I will move the world. " -- Archimedes

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "Remember, remember always, that all of us, and you and I especially, are descended from immigrants and revolutionists." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "We may not pay Satan reverence, for that would be indiscreet, but we can at least respect his talents." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Jim Wallis
item.description: "The failure of political leaders to help uplift the poor will be judged a moral failure." -- Jim Wallis

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description:
"I have observed, indeed, generally, that while in protestant countries the defections from the Platonic Christianity of the priests is to Deism, in catholic countries they are to Atheism. [author:Diderot|11004], [author:D'Alembert|3295333], [author:Dâ€™Holbach|1228712], [author:Condorcet|6420223], are known to have been among the most virtuous of men. Their virtue, then, must have had some other foundation than the love of God.
[<i>Letter to Thomas Law, 13 June 1814</i>]" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Moxie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Marilyn French
item.description: "All the women I know feel a little like outlaws." -- Marilyn French

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "The wind is us-- it gathers and remembers all our voices, then sends them talking and telling through the leaves and the fields." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Moxie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero
